{{ more footnotes|date=April 2009 }} {{Infobox person |name = Mary McCarthy Gomez Cueto |image = |birth_name = Mary McCarthy |birth_date = {{birth date|1900|4|27|mf=y}} |birth_place = [[St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador|St. John's]], [[Newfoundland and Labrador|Newfoundland]] |death_date = {{death date and age|2009|4|3|1901|4|3|mf=y}} |death_place = [[Havana]], [[Cuba]] |occupation = Artist, Teacher, Impresario |nationality = [[Canadians|Canadian]] }} '''Mary McCarthy Gomez Cueto''' (April 27, 1900 – April 3, 2009) was the widow of a wealthy Cuban businessman who died in poverty, unwilling to leave the island and unable to access her funds because of the [[US embargo on trade with Cuba]].<ref>[http://www.smh.com.au/national/obituaries/the-widow-who-withstood-castro-with-determination-and-prayer-20090409-a29n.html "The widow who withstood Castro with determination and prayer" ''The Sydney Morning Herald'', April 10, 2009]</ref> After her husband's death in 1951, and following the takeover of the Island under a [[Communist]] [[regime]], she had become an [[anachronism]], and ended her life in poverty, bereft of her wealth due to the U.S. embargo, and granted a tiny pension by the [[Castro government]]. A victim of political circumstance, she died there at the age of 108, and was buried next to her husband.
==Early years== Born Mary Conception McCarthy in [[St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador|St. John's]], [[Newfoundland and Labrador|Newfoundland]], she was the daughter of a St. John's merchant of Irish descent. Her father's (Thomas McCarthy) store supplied the local fishing fleets with stores and supplies. As a young student she studied with the [[Sisters of Mercy]], where she was quickly identified as a musical talent. As a young woman, furthering her studies in Boston, she met Pedro Gomez Cueto, a Spanish businessman. A smitten Gomez Cueto accompanied Mary back to St. John's to ask her father for permission to marry his daughter. Thomas McCarthy questioned his daughter's desire to marry the considerably older wealthy Spaniard. As a compromise he required Mary to stay at home and Gomez Cueto to go away for one year. If after that time they still wished to marry, he would give his blessing.
They married and settled in [[Havana]], [[Cuba]] in 1923, becoming part of the wealthy enclave enjoying the life of the rich and famous.
==Life in Cuba== Cueto was in the business of exporting leather goods to South America, but in Cuba he made his fortune making military boots for the United States in the Second World War. He built his wife a white mansion in 1936 called Villa Mary, which became their home. It was filled with [[Napoleon III furniture]] and chandeliers, and a Steinway grand piano, becoming a gathering place for visiting artists and singers, such as [[Frank Sinatra]] (who had a house behind hers) and [[Nat King Cole]]. In those days, under the rule of President [[Fulgencio Batista]], the island was known as "a millionaires' paradise". They became part of local society, and helped to found the Havana Philharmonic Orchestra and an orphanage for boys. Then in 1951 her husband died, and her life changed drastically under [[Fidel Castro's revolution]] of 1959.
The US imposed a trade embargo against Cuba in 1962, causing her U.S. bank account of about 4 million dollars to be frozen. Unable to touch her money, things became worse when Castro confiscated her island holdings, and granted her a monthly pension of 200 pesos (about $15). While free to return to her native Canada, or the United States, she vowed never to leave the Island, for that was her home. Despite trips back to St. John's where parties would be held for her, she felt that the weather was too cold. And so this native Canadian continued to live in Cuba in poverty, a relic from days gone by.
Her neighbors had left the island long before, and their mansions were converted into embassy residences. Peacocks continued to strut under the palm trees in her large garden. The mansion now still retains the elegance and graceful atmosphere that Mary so carefully maintained for more than seven decades.
==Later years== In 2002 she broke her hip and used a wheelchair, but continued to wear a satin dress, [[silk blouse]], chiffon scarf and lipstick to greet her visitors.
With the need for more money due to her medical problems, some measure of relief came in 2007 through a Canadian diplomat. Washington allowed her to draw from her inheritance $96 a month. "I don't even want to buy candy," she declared in her distinctive [[Newfoundland Irish]] accent. Mary's caregiver was godson Elio, who lived with Mary and looked after her night and day for several decades. Sadly, each time Mary was hospitalized in the Havana medical facilities set aside for tourists, Elio had to seek the help of the Government of Canada to intervene and free up Mary's own money from a frozen U.S. account to pay the medical bills, on a case-by-case basis.
Reminders of her long life were on the walls where framed telegrams hung from [[Queen Elizabeth II]] and [[Pope John Paul II]], congratulating her on her 100th birthday, and photographs on the table showed her with the conductor [[Sir Thomas Beecham]] and the guitarist [[Andrés Segovia]].
Asked whether she approved of [[Fidel Castro]] and his revolution, she did concede that poverty and illiteracy ended with his rule.
==Death== She died on Friday, April 3, 2009, just 24 days short of her 109th birthday, and was buried next to her husband in a white marble crypt in the [[Necropolis Cristóbal Colón]], in Havana.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/politics-obituaries/5115758/Mary-McCarthy-Gomez-Cueto.html Obituary, Daily Telegraph April 6, 2009] *[http://timeinmoments.wordpress.com/2009/04/07/denied-her-fortune-mary-mccarthy-died-in-cuba-friday/ Denied her fortune Mary McCarthy died in Cuba Friday] Moments in time. *[http://www.macleans.ca/society/mary-conception-mccarthy-gomez-cueto-1900-2009/ Maclean's Magazine April 23, 2009]
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Cueto, Mary McCarthy Gomez}} [[Category:1900 births]] [[Category:2009 deaths]] [[Category:Canadian centenarians]] [[Category:Cuban centenarians]] [[Category:Cuban people]]

{{other uses}} {{more footnotes|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox person |name = Nicolae Bălcescu |birth_date = 29 June 1819 |birth_place = [[Bucharest]], [[Wallachia]] (now in Romania) |death_date = {{death date and age|1852|11|29|1819|6|29|df=y}} |death_place = [[Palermo]], [[Two Sicilies]] (now in Italy) |image = Gheorghe Tattarescu - Nicolae Balcescu.jpg |caption = 1851 portrait of Bălcescu
by [[Gheorghe Tattarescu]] |organization = ''Frăția'', 1848 Wallachian Provisional Government }} '''Nicolae Bălcescu''' ({{IPA-ro|nikoˈla.e bəlˈt͡ʃesku}}) (29 June 1819 – 29 November 1852) was a [[Romanians|Romanian]] [[Wallachia]]n soldier, historian, journalist, and leader of the [[1848 Wallachian Revolution]]. ==Early life== Born in [[Bucharest]] to a family of low-ranking nobility, he used his mother's maiden name, in place of his father's name, ''Petrescu'' (his mother was originally from [[Bălcești]], [[Vâlcea County]] now, then [[Argeș County]]). His siblings were Costache, [[Barbu Bălcescu|Barbu]], Sevasta and Marghioala, and his father died in 1824. As a boy, Bălcescu studied at the [[Saint Sava College]] (from 1832), and was a passionate student of history. At the age of 19, he joined the [[Wallachian Army]], and, in 1840, took part, alongside [[Eftimie Murgu]] and [[Cezar Bolliac]], in [[Mitică Filipescu]]'s [[Conspiracy (political)|conspiracy]] against Prince [[Alexandru II Ghica]]. The plot was uncovered, and Bălcescu was imprisoned in [[Mărgineni Monastery]], where he remained for the following two years. The rough imprisonment conditions left irreversible marks on Bălcescu's health. Upon his release (after being granted a [[pardon]] by the new prince, [[Gheorghe Bibescu]]), he took part in forming a [[secret society]] drawn up from the [[Freemasonry]]{{citation needed|date=February 2013}} and named ''Frăția'' ("The Brotherhood"), which he led together with [[Ion Ghica]] and [[Christian Tell]] (joined soon after by [[Gheorghe Magheru]]) in resistance against Prince Bibescu. ==''Magazin istoric pentru Dacia'' and other early works== [[Image:Magazin istoric pentru Dacia - 1845.png|thumb|230px|First page of ''Magazin istoric pentru Dacia'', Volume I, 1845]] In order to further his history studies, Bălcescu went to France and Italy, and was, together with [[August Treboniu Laurian]], the editor of a magazine entitled ''Magazin istoric pentru Dacia'', which was first published in 1844; that year also marked the publishing (in a different magazine) of his historical essay ''Puterea armată și arta militară de la întemeierea Prințipatului Valahiei și până acum'' ("The Military Strength and Art of Warfare from the Creation of the Wallachian Principality to This Day", which argued for a strong military as a guarantee of [[self-determination]]). While in Paris (1846), he became leader of the [[Romantic nationalism|Romantic nationalists]] and [[Liberalism and radicalism in Romania|liberal-radical]] group ''Societatea studenților români'' (the Society of Romanian Students), which reunited Wallachians and [[Moldavia]]ns — it also included [[Ion Brătianu]], [[Alexandru C. Golescu]], [[Ion Ionescu de la Brad]], [[C. A. Rosetti]], and [[Mihail Kogălniceanu]]. ''Magazin istoric'' went on to publish the very first collection of internal sources on the history of Wallachia and Moldavia - medieval [[chronicle]]s which were afterwards published as a single volume. One of his contributions to the magazine singles him out as a radical liberal: ''Despre starea socială a muncitorilor plugari în Principatele Române în deosebite timpuri'' ("On the Social Status of the Ploughmen of the [[Danubian Principalities|Romanian Principalities]] at Various Times") argues for a [[land reform]], aimed at dispossessing the [[boyars]] of large plots of land (that would in turn be awarded to landless peasants); it was used as reference by [[Karl Marx]] in his succinct analysis of the events, a fact which was to earn Bălcescu credentials in [[Communist Romania]]. ==Wallachian Revolution== {{Main article|Wallachian Revolution of 1848}} In 1848, after taking part in the [[Revolutions of 1848 in France|uprising in France]], Bălcescu returned to [[Bucharest]] in order to take part in the 11 June revolution. He was, for just two days, both [[political minister|Minister]] and [[Secretary of State]] of the [[provisional government]] put in place by the revolutionaries. His advocacy of [[universal suffrage]] and land reform was not shared by many revolutionaries, and his group came into conflict with the traditional figures of authority - the [[Eastern Orthodox Church|Orthodox]] [[Metropolitan of Hungro-Wallachia|Metropolitan]] {{Interlanguage link multi|Neofit II|ro|3=Neofit al II-lea}}, although head of the revolutionary government, opposed the reforms and ultimately conspired against the Revolution itself. Bălcescu was arrested on 13 September that year by the authorities of the [[Ottoman Empire]] who had put an end to the Revolution; his relationship with the Ottomans was complicated by the fact that the radicals' strict opposition to [[Imperial Russia]] had made them reliable for the [[Ottoman Porte|Porte]] - the Ottomans later allowed all participants in the events to take refuge in [[Istanbul]], and thus avoid contact with the Russian troops sent over to assist the Ottoman presence. Bălcescu initially made his way to [[Transylvania]], but was expelled by [[Habsburg Monarchy|Habsburg]] authorities, who considered him a threat and an agitator of Romanian sentiment in that region. ==In Istanbul and Transylvania== In early 1849, Bălcescu was in Istanbul when the [[Revolutions of 1848 in the Habsburg areas#Revolution in the Kingdom of Hungary|Hungarian revolutionary armies]] under [[Józef Bem]] mounted a successful offensive against Habsburg forces and their Transylvanian Romanian allies. The Hungarian government of [[Lajos Kossuth]] then entered a debilitating war with [[Avram Iancu]]'s Romanian [[Guerilla warfare|guerilla force]], and the former members of the Wallachian government were approached by the [[Wielkopolska Uprising (1848)|Polish revolutionaries]] in exile, such as [[Henryk Dembiński]], to mediate a peace between the two sides (in the hope that this was to ensure a stronger resistance to Russia, and counting on the Wallachian resentment towards the [[Saint Petersburg]] government). Bălcescu left for [[Debrecen]] in May, and met with Kossuth to register the latter's offer to Iancu. [[Marxism|Marxist]]-inspired historiography has celebrated this as an agreement; in fact, Bălcescu's papers reveal that he viewed the peace offering as unsatisfactory for Romanians, and that Avram Iancu rejected it altogether (while agreeing to a temporary [[armistice]]). The final offer from the [[Budapest]] leadership to Bălcescu and Iancu called for the Romanians to withdraw from Transylvania, as the region was turning into a battleground between Russia and the Hungarians. When this latter conflict drew to a close, the Romanians in Transylvania, although never particularly welcoming of the Russian presence, surrendered their weapons to the reinstated Habsburgs (Iancu's loyalty to the dynasty had been the subject of a parallel dispute between him and the Wallachians). ==Final years== [[Image:Nobalcescu.jpg|thumb|Bălcescu's bust in Palermo]] Bălcescu's most important work is ''Românii supt Mihai-Voievod Viteazul'' ("Romanians under the Rule of [[Michael the Brave]]"), which he wrote in exile in 1849 - first published posthumously by [[Alexandru Odobescu]] in 1860. The volume is history of Michael's campaigns, as the first moment when Wallachia, Transylvania, and Moldavia, came under a single, albeit brief rule. They show Bălcescu's commitment to both radicalism and [[nationalism]], his view oscillating between praise of Michael's gestures and criticism of his stance as a supporter of [[serfdom]] and [[Privilege (legal ethics)|privilege]]. His final years saw an intense publishing activity, including his study, written in French, {{lang|fr|Question économique des Principautés Danubiennes}}, as well as a collaboration with [[Adam Mickiewicz]] on ''[[La Tribune des Peuples]]''. Stricken by [[tuberculosis]], impoverished, and constantly moving between various locations in France and the [[Italian Peninsula]], he died in [[Palermo]] (in the [[Two Sicilies]]) at 33 years of age. Bălcescu never married, though he and his lover Alexandra Florescu had a son, [[Bonifaciu Florescu]] (1848–1899), who became a professor of French language and literature. ==Nationalization of his properties== {{Confusing section|date=January 2013}} In the present his properties remain nationalized by the [[Romanian Government]] 2011, after 1945, as [[Bălcesti Giltofani Land]] in [[Bălcești]] which in the present is [[Nicolae Bălcescu Museum]], taken from Bălcescu's family member [[Radu Mandrea]] and [[Aristide Razu]], in 1948 by a "donation act" towards the Communist Government, in [[Romania]], in [[Vâlcea County]]. Also his earthly remains, remain in [[Palermo]], Italy, although the [[Communist Party of Romania]] tried to bring them back to Romania in 1970, to use them for communist propaganda. The [[Order of Friars Minor Capuchin|Capuchin]] Monks in Palermo at the [[Capuchin Monastery]], also known as [[Capuchin catacombs of Palermo]], denied to the [[Romanian Communist Delegation of Historians]] access to the grave. ==References== * [[Lucian Boia]], ''Istorie și mit în conștiința românească'', Bucharest, Humanitas, 1997 * Lucian Boia, ed., ''Miturile comunismului românesc'', Bucharest, Nemira, 1998: Adrian Drăgușanu, "Nicolae Bălcescu în propaganda comunistă" (p. 98-132) * Liviu Maior, ''1848–1849. Români și unguri în revoluție'', Bucharest, Editura Enciclopedică, 1998 * Ion Ranca, Valeriu Nițu, ''Avram Iancu: documente și bibliografie'', Bucharest, Editura Științifică, 1974 ==External links== {{Wikisourcelang|ro|Autor:Nicolae Bălcescu|Nicolae Bălcescu (works in Romanian)}} * [http://www.marxists.org/archive/marx/works/cw/volume09/footnote.htm Footnotes to Vol. 9 of the ''Marx-Engels Collected Works''] at [[Marxists.org]] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060909041033/http://www.ohiou.edu/%7eChastain/ac/balcescu.htm ''Balcescu, Nicolae''], by [[Dan Berindei]], September 9, 2004, at the Encyclopedia of 1848 Revolutions {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Balcescu, Nicolae}} [[Category:Romanian revolutionaries]] [[Category:People of the Revolutions of 1848]] [[Category:Romanian essayists]] [[Category:Romanian magazine editors]] [[Category:Romanian magazine founders]] [[Category:Romanian writers in French]] [[Category:People from Bucharest]] [[Category:Romanian expatriates in Italy]] [[Category:Saint Sava National College alumni]] [[Category:19th-century deaths from tuberculosis]] [[Category:1819 births]] [[Category:1852 deaths]] [[Category:19th-century journalists]] [[Category:Male journalists]] [[Category:Infectious disease deaths in Italy]] [[Category:19th-century Romanian historians]] [[Category:Male essayists]] [[Category:Members of the Romanian Academy elected posthumously]] [[Category:19th-century essayists]] [[Category:19th-century male writers]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Oswald de Kerchove de Denterghem | image = Oswald de Kerchove de Denterghem.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Oswald Charles Eugène Marie Ghislain de Kerchove de Denterghem | birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1844|4|1}} | birth_place = [[Ghent]], [[Belgium]] | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|1906|3|20|1844|4|1}} | death_place = Ghent, Belgium | nationality = [[Belgium]] | other_names = | known_for = | occupation = politician, lawyer }} '''Oswald Charles Eugène Marie Ghislain de Kerchove de Denterghem''' (1 April 1844 – 20 March 1906),[http://www.liberaalarchief.be/D.html Liberaal Archief] was a [[Belgium|Belgian]] liberal politician.[http://www.liberaalarchief.be/waarden_oswdekerchove.html Biography in Liberaal Archief] Oswald de Kerchove was a son of the [[Ghent]]ian [[mayor]] [[Charles de Kerchove de Denterghem]].
De Kerchove was a [[lawyer]] and became a liberal [[Belgian Senate|senator]]. He was [[governor]] in [[Hainaut (province)|Hainaut]] from 1878 to 1884.
He was an internationally recognized authority in the study of [[Palm tree|palm]]s and [[orchid]]s. {{Botanist|Kerch.|Kerchove}} == Bibliography == * Oswald de Kerchove de Denterghem, ''Les palmiers histoire iconographinque'', Paris, published by J. Rothschild, 1878.[http://shigitatsu.com/Palm%20Prints/Palm%20Prints.htm Chromolithographs] * Oswald de Kerchove de Denterghem, ''Le Livre des Orchidées'', 1894.[http://www.suttonbooks.com/cgi-bin/rsb/45397.html?id=dtXKuCyw Sutton Antiquarion Books] == References == {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:De Kerchove De Denterghem, Oswald}} [[Category:1844 births]] [[Category:1906 deaths]] [[Category:Governors of Hainaut (province)]] [[Category:Belgian naturalists]] [[Category:Flemish people]] [[Category:Flemish nobility]] [[Category:19th-century Belgian scientists]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=February 2015}} {{more footnotes|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Tara Dawn Holland | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|10|02}} | birth_place = [[Mobile, Alabama]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | body_discovered = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality = [[Franklin, Tennessee]] | citizenship = | other_names = | known_for = | education = | alma_mater = [[University of Missouri–Kansas City]]
[[Florida State University]] | employer = | occupation = | years_active = | home_town = | salary = | networth = | title = Miss Flint Hills 1996
[[Miss Kansas]] 1996
[[Miss America]] 1997 | term = | predecessor = [[Shawntel Smith]] | successor = [[Katherine Shindle]] | party = | opponents = | boards = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Jon Lynn Christensen]]|1998}} | partner = | children = 2 | parents = | relations = | callsign = | awards = | signature = | website = {{URL|www.taradawn.net}} | footnotes = }} '''Tara Dawn Holland''' (born October 2, 1972) is an American [[Beauty contest|beauty pageant]] contestant, who was [[Miss America 1997]]. ==Education== In December 2002, Holland graduated [[summa cum laude]] with her [[master’s degree]] in [[music education]] from the [[University of Missouri–Kansas City]]. ==Literacy advocacy== After six years as a local [[literacy]] [[Advocacy|advocate]] and [[tutor]], she took her cause to the national spotlight when she was crowned Miss America 1997. She spent the year fighting for literacy education for people of all ages and backgrounds, as well as raising funds and motivating those involved in the cause. Since her year of service, she has continued to speak for local, state, and national organizations on this critical issue. ==Public appearances== In addition to traveling as a speaker, Holland has enjoyed many opportunities to perform musically. She has been featured as a vocal soloist with the [[Kansas City Symphony]], the [[Service bands#Air Force Band|U.S. Air Force Band]], and the [[NATO]] Band in [[Italy]]. She was also a featured vocalist in the nationally televised [[Boston Pops]] [[Fourth of July]] Celebration and the [[Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade]]. In addition, she had the honor of singing at two of President [[George W. Bush]]'s [[inaugural]] events, including the Armory Ball, the largest official Inaugural Ball. Holland has appeared on various media outlets, including ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'', ''[[Live with Regis and Kathie Lee]]'', ''[[Today (NBC program)|Today]]'', ''[[Fox News Sunday]]'' with [[Tony Snow]], ''[[Parade (magazine)|Parade]]'', ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'', and [[Focus on the Family]] radio show, among others. In addition to commercials, [[public service announcement]]s, and her cameo role on ''[[The Nanny (TV series)|The Nanny]]'', some of her other highlights are the 1997 Kansan of the Year, President Bush’s Daily Point of Light #723, and the 1997 Kansas Woman of Achievement. ==Personal life== Holland and her husband, former [[U.S. Congressman]] [[Jon Lynn Christensen]], live in [[Franklin, Tennessee]].{{cite web|first1=Michelle |last1=Tauber |first2=Mike |last2=Neill |first3=Lisa |last3=Russell |first4=Joanne|last4=Fowler |first5=Julie |last5=Dam |first6=Alex |last6=Tresniowski |first7=Samantha |last7=Miller |first8=Steve |last8=Dougherty |first9=Ting |last9=Yu |title= American Beauties: 80 Years |work= People |url=https://people.com/archive/american-beauties-80-years-vol-54-no-16/ |date=October 16, 2000}} They have two daughters, Petra and Sela. Holland is active with youth, both in her local community and as a national [[sexual abstinence]] speaker to tens of thousands of students per year. She also sings and speaks for women’s groups, fundraisers, and churches. ==Trivia== The video of her receiving her crown was shown at the beginning of the 2006 film, ''[[Little Miss Sunshine]]''. ==References== ==External links== * [http://www.taradawn.net/ Official website] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20111215073017/http://www.missamerica.org/our-miss-americas/1990/1997.aspx Miss America profile] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060714181329/http://www.speakersaccess.com/speaker.php?id=780 21st Century Speakers Inc. profile] {{s-start}} {{s-ach}} {{succession box | before = [[Shawntel Smith]] | title = [[Miss America]] | years = 1997 | after = [[Katherine Shindle]] }} {{succession box | before = Amy Keller | title = [[Miss Kansas]] | years = 1996 | after = Jennifer Parks }} {{succession box | before = Heather Geery | title = [[National Sweetheart]] | years = 1995 | after = Stacey Momeyer }} {{s-end}} {{MissAmericas 1980–1999}} {{Miss America}} {{Miss America 1997 Delegates}} {{Kansas pageant winners}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Holland, Tara Dawn}} [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Mobile, Alabama]] [[Category:People from Franklin, Tennessee]] [[Category:Miss America 1997 delegates]] [[Category:Miss America winners]] [[Category:Literacy advocates]] [[Category:Florida State University alumni]] [[Category:University of Missouri–Kansas City alumni]] [[Category:Musicians from Kansas]] [[Category:Miss America Preliminary Swimsuit winners]] [[Category:Toastmasters members]]

{{Infobox person | name = Teuku Wisnu | image = | Background = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1985|03|04}} | birth_place = [[Jakarta]], [[Indonesia]] | occupation = [[Actor]], [[Television presenter|Presenter]] | yearsactive = 2005 - present | spouse = [[Shireen Sungkar]] | URL = }}
'''Teuku Wisnu''' (born March 4, 1985) is an Indonesian soap opera and film actor. He is 178 cm tall and weighs 68 kg and has starred in several soap operas, movies, advertisements and became a presenter. Wisnu is currently listed as a FISIP student in the Department of International Relations at [[Moestopo University]] Jakarta.
== Career ==
Wisnu began his entertainment career with a car accident. At that time, Wisnu drove a car owned by his aunt and had an accident on the highway in the city. Because he did not have the money to repair his aunt's damaged car, Wisnu, on the advice of his friend, attended the ''casting'' of an [[advertising|advertisement]].<ref>[http://www.kapanlagi.com/h/0000192779.html Accident toll Bring Blessings For Teuku Wisnu], accessed 21 November 2007</ref> Since then the name and figure of Teuku Wisnu began to be known to the public. He has been in some soap operas such as his role as Farel in ''[[Cinta Fitri]]''. Teuku Wisnu also had been a finalist on ''[[MTV VJ Hunt]]'' in 2006.
At the 12th [[Panasonic Award]], held on March 27, 2009, Wisnu successfully became the winner in the category Actor Favorites.
== Sinetron == * [[Makin Sayang]] * [[Benar Benar Cinta]] * Cinta Fitri ** [[Cinta Fitri (Musim 1)|Cinta Fitri Season 1]] ** [[Cinta Fitri (Musim 2)|Cinta Fitri Season 2]] ** [[Cinta Fitri (Musim 3)|Cinta Fitri Season 3]] ** [[Cinta Fitri (Musim Ramadhan)|Cinta Fitri Season Ramadhan 1 (Season 4)]] ** [[Cinta Fitri (Musim 5)|Cinta Fitri Season 5]] ** [[Cinta Fitri (Musim Ramadhan 2)|Cinta Fitri Season Ramadhan 2 (Season 6)]] ** [[Cinta Fitri (Musim 7)|Cinta Fitri Season 7]] * [[Ranum (sinetron)|Ranum]] * Zahra
== Filmography == * [[Gue Kapok Jatuh Cinta]] (2005) * ''[[Lentera Merah]]'' (2006) * [[Suka Ma Suka]] (2009)
== Single == * '''[[Hipnotis (album)|Cintaku Adalah Takdirmu]]''' (featuring. [[Indah Dewi Pertiwi]]) * '''Cinta Kita''' (featuring. Shireen Sungkar) * '''[[Indonesia Raya]]''' (featuring. Shireen Sungkar) * '''Dia Yang Ku Minta''' (Teuku Wisnu) * '''Syukur''' (Teuku Wisnu)
== Achievements == * Favorite Actor ([[Panasonic Awards 2009]]) * Nominator Favorite Actor ([[Panasonic Gobel Awards 2010]] and [[Panasonic Gobel Awards 2011]]) * Favorite Actor (Indonesia Kids Choice Awards 2008) * Favorite Actor (Indonesia Kids Choice Awards 2009) * Favorite Actor (Indonesia Kids Choice Awards 2010) * Favorite Actor (Indonesia Kids Choice Awards 2011]) * Aktor Ngetop ([[SCTV Awards]] 2007, 2008, 2009, and 2010)
== Other appearances == * 2009/2010: Adzan Subuh in [[SCTV (Indonesia)|SCTV]] * 2009/2010: Adzan Maghrib in SCTV (only for SCTV broadcast in [[Jakarta]])

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people. Non-free and "fair use" images, e.g. promo photos, CD/DVD covers, posters, screen captures, etc., will be deleted - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | | imagesize = 150px | | name = Tom Hickey | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1944}} | birth_place = [[Kildare]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] | death_date = | death_place = | restingplace = | restingplacecoordinates = | othername = | occupation = [[Actor]] | yearsactive = 1963–present | spouse = | domesticpartner = | children = | parents = | influences = | influenced = | website = | awards = }} '''Tom Hickey''' (born 1944) is an [[Republic of Ireland|Irish]] actor who has appeared on stage and screen in a career that began in the early 1960s. He is, perhaps, best known for playing Benjy Riordan in the long-running television series, ''[[The Riordans]]''.
==Early life== Born in [[Kildare]],<ref>''Sunday Independent'', "Enjoying the psychic magic", July 14, 2002</ref> Hickey began his career in 1963 at [[Deirdre O'Connell]]'s Stanislavski Studio in [[Dublin]] where he trained in [[Stanislavski's system]] of acting.<ref>''The Irish Times'', "Memories in Focus, July 25, 1992,</ref> He has said that he sees his choice of profession as a "vocation", having decided to become an actor when he was five or six years old.<ref>''The Irish Times'', "A multiple one-to-one experience", July 16, 2005</ref>
==Television== In 1965, Hickey joined the cast of [[RTÉ One|RTÉ television]]'s new rural drama series, ''[[The Riordans]]''. He went on to play the part of Benjy Riordan in the successful serial for the next sixteen years.<ref>''The Irish Times'', "After the Riordans", July 9, 1981</ref>
In 2001, he made a rare venture into [[Television advertisement|television advertising]] with his appearances in a series of commercials for [[Club Orange]], a [[soft drink]].<ref>''Irish Independent'', "176 reality shows... get me out of here!", January 13, 2005,</ref> The first of these was directed by [[Declan Lowney]], the director of ''[[Father Ted]]''.<ref>''The Irish Times'', "C&C to double spend on Club Orange brand with elaborate and surreal television campaign", December 6, 2001</ref> Lowney also directed ''[[Moone Boy]]'', a [[Sky (United Kingdom)|Sky]] television series in which Hickey played Granddad Joe.
==Stage== On stage, Hickey has favoured parts in the work of modern Irish playwrights such as [[Tom Murphy (playwright)|Tom Murphy]], [[Frank McGuinness]], [[Bernard Farrell]], and [[Marina Carr]]. In the early 1980s, the playwright [[Tom MacIntyre]] asked him to play the lead role in his adaptation of [[Patrick Kavanagh]]'s poem ''The Great Hunger''. Following the success of that collaboration, he has become an acclaimed interpreter of MacIntyre's work, in such plays as ''Rise Up Lovely Sweeney'', ''The Gallant John Joe'' and ''What Happened Bridgie Cleary''.<ref>''The Irish Times'', "Between two worlds", April 21, 2005</ref>
==Cinema== As a [[character actor]], Hickey has appeared in numerous films, including [[My Left Foot (film)|''My Left Foot'']], ''[[Inside I'm Dancing]]'', and [[Breakfast on Pluto (film)|''Breakfast on Pluto'']]. He was also cast in two of director [[Lenny Abrahamson]]'s films: ''[[Garage (film)|Garage]]'' and ''[[What Richard Did]]''.
==Personal life== In 2013, Hickey was diagnosed with [[Parkinson's Disease]].<ref>[http://www.independent.ie/regionals/sligochampion/lifestyle/actor-tom-hickey-urges-parkinsons-patients-to-reach-out-31121281.html ''Sligo Champion'', "Actor Tom Hickey urges Parkinson's patients to reach out", 11 Apr. 2015]</ref> During an interview on ''[[The Marian Finucane Show]]'' on 11 April 2015, he spoke of his determination to continue acting despite the onset of this condition.<ref>[http://www.rte.ie/radio1/marian-finucane/ ''Marian Finucane'', RTÉ Radio 1]</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.irishplayography.com/person.aspx?personid=2024 Tom Hickey at Irish Playography] *{{IMDb name|0382675}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080108110744/http://www.lisarichards.ie/actor_585.html Tom Hickey agency bio]
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Hickey, Tom}} [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:Irish male stage actors]] [[Category:Irish male film actors]] [[Category:Irish male television actors]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Irish male soap opera actors]] [[Category:People with Parkinson's disease]]

{{short description|Privately built Danish midget submarine}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}}
{|{{Infobox Ship Begin |display title=ital}} |+ ''UC3 Nautilus'' {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=Submarine UC3Nautilus seatrials 2008.jpg |Ship caption=''UC3 Nautilus'' in early sea trials }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= {{shipboxflag|Denmark|civil}} |Ship name= ''UC3 Nautilus'' |Ship namesake= |Ship owner= |Ship operator= |Ship registry= |Ship route= |Ship ordered= |Ship awarded= |Ship builder= |Ship original cost= |Ship yard number= |Ship way number= |Ship laid down= |Ship launched=3 May 2008 |Ship sponsor= |Ship christened= |Ship completed= |Ship maiden voyage= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship homeport= |Ship identification= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship fate= {{As of|2017|8|12}}, seized by the police |Ship status= Confiscated, awaiting destruction<ref name="Nordjyske 25 April">{{cite web | url=https://nordjyske.dk/nyheder/efter-livstid-til-peter-madsen-ubaaden-konfiskeres/4b5aa5db-a148-4607-b76d-6b3aac51980c | publisher=[[Nordjyske Stiftstidende]] | title=Efter livstid til Peter Madsen: Ubåden konfiskeres | date=25 April 2018 | access-date=25 April 2018 | language=da | trans-title=After life imprisonment to Peter Madsen: The submarine has been confiscated }}</ref> |Ship notes= |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type= [[Midget submarine]] |Ship tonnage={{GT|40}} |Ship displacement= |Ship length={{convert|17.76|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|2|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draught= |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship power= |Ship propulsion=*1 [[diesel engine]] * 1 [[electric motor]] |Ship speed= {{convert|6|kn|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship crew=4–8 |Ship sensors= |Ship notes= }} |} '''''UC3 Nautilus''''' is a privately built Danish [[midget submarine]]. It was built over a three-year period as an art project by [[Peter Madsen (inventor)|Peter Madsen]] and a group of volunteers, and cost approximately [[United States dollar|US$]]200,000 to build (1.5 million [[Danish krone|DKK]]). The submarine was Madsen's third submarine design, and at the time of launch on 3 May 2008, was the largest privately built submarine in the world.<ref>{{Cite web |url= http://jp.dk/indland/kbh/article1331560.ece |title=Verdens største privatbyggede ubåd søsættes i København |trans-title=The world's largest privately built submarine launched in Copenhagen |work=[[Jyllandsposten]] |accessdate=6 July 2010|language=da}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url= http://www.berlingske.dk/danmark/klar-til-dykning |title=Klar til dykning |trans-title=Ready for diving |work=[[Berlingske Tidende]] |accessdate=6 July 2010|language=da}}</ref>
On 11 August 2017, ''Nautilus'' sank in the bay of [[Køge]], in what investigators determined was a deliberate act.<ref>{{Cite web |url= https://www.b.dk/nationalt/ubaaden-uc3-nautilus-er-sunket-passagererne-er-kommet-i-land-og-er-i-god-behold |title=Ubåden »UC3 Nautilus« er sunket: Passagererne er kommet i land og er i god behold |work=[[Berlingske]] |accessdate=11 August 2017 |language=da }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url= https://www.theguardian.com/global/2017/aug/13/submarine-maker-held-as-search-for-kim-wall-continues |title=Submarine in missing journalist case sunk on purpose, Danish police say |work=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=23 August 2017 |language=en }}</ref> The following day, [[Danish police]] had the submarine salvaged and brought onto land as part of the investigation of the death of Swedish journalist [[Murder of Kim Wall|Kim Wall]], who was last seen alive on board.<ref name=dr_2017_08_12>{{cite news|url= http://www.dr.dk/nyheder/indland/kranskib-haever-sunket-ubaad-op-til-overfladen |website= [[dr.dk]] |title= Kranskib hæver sunket ubåd op til overfladen |first= Anders Holm |last= Nielsen |date= 12 August 2017 |accessdate= 12 August 2017 |language= da |trans-title= Crane ship brings sunken submarine back to the surface}}</ref> As part of the conviction of Madsen for Wall's murder, the submarine was confiscated and is awaiting destruction.<ref name="Nordjyske 25 April"/>
==Launch== On the day of its launch on 3 May 2008, ''UC3 Nautilus'' displaced only 32 tons and was still incomplete. It was named at a well-attended ceremony on the west side of [[Refshaleøen]] and towed to the floating [[installation art]] [[barge]] ''Illutron'' (formerly M/S ''Half Machine'') in the [[Kongens Enghave]], where further outfitting and installation of equipment took place over the next several months. By August 2008, ''Nautilus'' could sail on its own, as the main diesel engine [[drive train]] and steering was completed. On its [[maiden voyage]], the submarine was driven by former crewmen of the now-defunct<ref>{{Cite web |url= http://www.navalhistory.dk/English/TheShips/Classes/Tumleren_Class(1989).htm |title=''Tumleren'' Class Submarines (1989–2004) |work=Danish Naval History |accessdate=6 July 2010 }}</ref> [[Royal Danish Navy]] submarine division.<ref name=ing>{{Cite web |url = http://ing.dk/artikel/106379-nyt-om-undervandsbaaden-nautilus |title = Nyt om undervandsbåden Nautilus |trans-title=News about the submarine Nautilus |work = [[Ingeniøren]] |accessdate = 6 July 2010 |language = da |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20100903172102/http://ing.dk/artikel/106379-nyt-om-undervandsbaaden-nautilus |archivedate = 3 September 2010 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> The objective was to sail ''Nautilus'' and evaluate her maneuverability, and the appraisal was favourable. In October 2008, Nautilus was submerged for the first time.<ref name=ing/>
==Specifications== {{refimprove|section|date=April 2018}} ''Nautilus'' can be crewed by up to eight people for surface operation and four when diving. The submarine moves at five to six [[Knot (unit)|knots]], depending on conditions and whether it was submerged. It has two {{convert|1500|l|usgal}} tanks for fresh water and fuel. [[Trim (attitude)|Trim]] is carried out normally with an electric pump, or with compressed air as fall-back if the trim-pump fails. The main ballast tanks of {{convert|8,000|l|usgal}} are filled and emptied with compressed air and can flush up to {{convert|400|l|usgal}} of water in/out per second. It can descend to [[periscope depth]] in approximately 20 seconds.<ref name=ing/> The boat has a design [[crush depth]] of {{convert|400|-|500|m|ft|abbr=on}}, and has dived to about {{convert|100|m|ft|abbr=on}}.
There are 16 portholes (8 on each side, 2 oversized) for direct observation. The periscope has five video cameras, providing 360-degree panoramic vision on video screens in the forward control room. The engine room has two diesel engines, one of which is for direct propulsion. The other drives a three-phase electric generator providing power for the onboard air compressor and battery charger. There are more than a tonne of large 12-volt batteries on board, supplying the DC electric motor which can be operated alone or in tandem with the main engine on a chain-coupled drive for turning the 80 kilogram, five-bladed brass propeller. Joystick-controlled electric servos operate the rudder (aft) and [[diving plane|hydroplanes]] (front).
''Nautilus'' is much smaller than the Danish [[Kobben-class submarine]]. It is about half as long and half as wide, and moves at about half the speed. In early 2009, an automatic [[Submarine snorkel|snorkel]] system was installed so that the submarine can sail submerged on diesel power, and in August it sailed out from [[Køge]] submerged.<ref name=ing/>
The submarine can be operated by a single person from the control room. All controls and indicators are accessible from the captain's seat for controlling buoyancy, pumps, engines, air pressure, communication, video, and other electric systems. However, as of July 2010, the engine crew still needed to perform manual changeover from surface to dive-ready configuration, setting valves correctly for snorkel and diesel engine exhaust. ''Nautilus'' can function on her diesel engine for up to eight minutes underwater without her snorkel. The engine requires a steady supply of air to operate, unlike the electric motor, and using it while submerged drops the air pressure to the equivalent of {{convert|3000|m|ft|abbr=on}} above sea level, as the engine ingests air from the crew compartment unless the snorkel is used.<ref name=ing/>
==Missions== On a 2009 trip around Refshaleøen, ''Nautilus'' was visited by a group of submarine fans from [[Subsim]]. Video game developers from [[Ubisoft]] were also on board to find inspiration for their submarine game, ''[[Silent Hunter 5]].''<ref name=ing/>
''Nautilus'' was used by her builders and various others for recreation and expeditions.<ref name="ing"/> One such expedition was the attempted launch of the rocket and spacecraft [[HEAT 1X Tycho Brahe]], built by Madsen's [[non-profit]] organization [[Copenhagen Suborbitals]]. On Tuesday 31 August 2010, the submarine pushed the launch platform ''Sputnik'', carrying the craft from Copenhagen towards the launch site near [[Nexø]], [[Bornholm]].<ref name="ingtow">{{cite news | first=Mette Buck | last=Jensen |url= http://ing.dk/artikel/111523-nyt-fra-raket-holdet-vi-naar-nexoe-kl-2030 |website= [[Ing.dk]] |title=Nyt fra raket-holdet: Vi når Nexø kl. 20.30 |trans-title=News from the rocket-team: We will reach Nexø at 20.30 |language= Danish |date= 1 September 2010 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100903235244/http://ing.dk/artikel/111523-nyt-fra-raket-holdet-vi-naar-nexoe-kl-2030 |archivedate=3 September 2010 |df= dmy-all }}</ref>
In January 2011, ''Nautilus'' returned to Refshaleøen to be taken on shore for upgrades, then expected to last several months.<ref>{{cite news | first1=K.V. | last1=Bengtson| first2=P. | last2=Madsen |url= http://ing.dk/artikel/115824-en-sten-fra-mit-hjerte-vi-er-hjemme-igen |website= [[Ing.dk]] |title= En sten fra mit hjerte – vi er hjemme igen |language= Danish |date= 20 January 2011 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110122085957/http://ing.dk/artikel/115824-en-sten-fra-mit-hjerte-vi-er-hjemme-igen |archivedate= 22 January 2011 |df= dmy-all }}</ref> On 28 April 2017, ''Nautilus'' was launched again following repairs and upgrades.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://rml.space/projects/submarines/uc3-nautilus |title=UC3 Nautilus |accessdate=2017-08-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170814191413/http://rml.space/projects/submarines/uc3-nautilus |archivedate=14 August 2017 |publisher=rml.space |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==Sinking in 2017== {{See also|Murder of Kim Wall|Peter Madsen#Murder of Kim Wall and sinking of UC3 Nautilus}} On 11 August 2017, ''Nautilus'' was scheduled to sail from Copenhagen to appear in the afternoon at an exhibit on Bornholm, but Madsen sent a text notifying the crew that the trip had been cancelled.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://jyllands-posten.dk/indland/ECE9783173/peter-madsen-aflyste-torsdag-aften-planlagt-ubaadstur-over-sms/ |website= [[jyllands-posten.dk]] |title= Peter Madsen aflyste torsdag aften planlagt ubådstur over sms |first= Emilie Holt |last= Vissing |date= 12 August 2017 |accessdate= 12 August 2017 |language= da |trans-title= Peter Madsen texts cancellation of planned submarine trip Thursday evening}}</ref><ref name=b_2017_08_12>{{cite news|url= https://www.b.dk/nationalt/drabssigtet-ubaadskaptajn-sendte-mystisk-sms-til-sin-besaetning |website= [[b.dk]] |title= Drabssigtet ubådskaptajn sendte mystisk SMS til sin besætning |first= Marianne |last= Fajstrup |date= 12 August 2017 |accessdate= 12 August 2017 |language= da |trans-title= Submarine captain charged with homicide sent mysterious text to his crew}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.b.dk/nationalt/ven-til-drabssigtet-ubaadsejer-der-er-intet-suspekt-ved-smser |website= b.dk |title= Ven til drabssigtet ubådsejer: Der er intet suspekt ved SMS'er |date= 12 August 2017 |accessdate= 12 August 2017 |language= da |trans-title= Friend of homicide charged submarine owner: Nothing suspicious about texts}}</ref> ''Nautilus'' was reported missing early the following morning. Danish police visited a crew member to establish who was on board, and a large search operation was launched using helicopters and ships in the port of [[Øresund]], just outside the harbour of Copenhagen.<ref name=b_2017_08_12/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dr.dk/nyheder/indland/forsvaret-leder-efter-privat-ubaad-frygter-den-er-sunket-i-oeresund |website= [[dr.dk]] |title=Forsvaret leder efter privat ubåd: Frygter den er sunket i Øresund |first=M.Ø. |last=Christensen |date= 11 August 2017 |language= da |trans-title=The Defence is looking for private submarine: Fear that it has sunken in Øresund}}</ref>
''Nautilus'' left Refshaleøen around 19:00 with Madsen and Swedish journalist [[Murder of Kim Wall|Kim Wall]] aboard.<ref name="dkpolice_pressrel">{{cite web|url= http://www.mynewsdesk.com/dk/koebenhavns-politi/pressreleases/drabssigtelse-i-sag-om-ubaad-2105443 | publisher=Copenhagen Police |website= [[mynewsdesk.com]] |title= Drabssigtelse i sag om ubåd |date= 11 August 2017 |accessdate= 12 August 2017 |language= da |trans-title= Homicide charge in submarine case}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Danish submarine owner arrested over missing journalist|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-40909469|accessdate=13 August 2017|publisher=BBC|date=12 August 2017}}</ref> At 11:00, it sank and Madsen was rescued by a private boat. Danish police charged him with murder, suspecting him of [[scuttling]] ''Nautilus'' to destroy evidence.<ref name="dkpolice_pressrel"/><ref name=bbc_2017_08_13>{{cite news|url= https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-40916787 |website= [[BBC News]] |title= Kim Wall: Danish submarine was 'deliberately sunk' |date= 13 August 2017 |accessdate= 13 August 2017}}</ref><ref name="ekstrabladet">{{cite news|url= http://ekstrabladet.dk/112/svensk-journalist-forsvundet-ubaadsejer-sigtet-for-drab/6775425 |website= [[ekstrabladet.dk]] |title= Svensk journalist forsvundet: Ubådsejer sigtet for drab |date= 11 August 2017 |accessdate= 12 August 2017 |language= da |trans-title= Swedish journalist disappeared: Submarine owner charged with homicide}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.buzzfeed.com/claudiakoerner/submarine-builder-arrested-on-suspicion-of-killing |website= [[buzzfeed.com]] |title= Submarine Builder Arrested On Suspicion Of Killing Journalist After Vessel Sinks |first= Claudia |last= Koerner |date= 12 August 2017 |accessdate= 12 August 2017}}</ref> The following day, Danish police had the submarine salvaged, brought onto land and began processing it for evidence.<ref name=dr_2017_08_12/> Madsen was convicted of Wall's murder in April 2018.<ref name=":15">{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/apr/25/peter-madsen-sentenced-life-murdering-kim-wall-submarine|title=Peter Madsen sentenced to life for murdering journalist Kim Wall|last=Orange|first=Richard|date=25 April 2018|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=25 April 2018}}</ref> As part of the conviction, the ownership of the submarine and all its content was transferred to the Danish State.<ref name="Nordjyske 25 April"/><ref name=domstoldk>{{cite web| url=http://www.domstol.dk/KobenhavnsByret/nyheder/domsresumeer/Pages/Domiubådssag.aspx |title=Dom i ubådssag |publisher=Københavns Byret, Danmarks Domstole |date=25 April 2018 |access-date=1 May 2018 |language=da |trans-title=Conviction in the submarine case}}</ref> It will be destroyed by authorities.<ref name="Nordjyske 25 April"/>
